kulami.game.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • kulami.game.board.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A Board is a representation of the positions of up to 17 panels on a 10 by 10 map.
    Author:
    gordon

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Board.FieldsNotEmptyException
      This exception indicates that the panel can not be placed because the fields are not empty.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Constructs a new Board with 17 Panels.

        Initially no panel is placed on the board.

    • Method Detail

      • putPanel

        public char putPanel(int size,
            Pos corner,
            Orientation orientation)
              throws Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException,
                     Panel.PanelNotPlacedException,
                     Board.FieldsNotEmptyException,
                     TooManyPanelsException
        Places a Panel on the Board.

        The calling method has to specify its size, upper left corner, and orientation specified. The method returns the assigned code if successful.

        Parameters:
        size - 2, 3, 4, or 6
        corner - position of the upper left corner
        orientation - vertical or horizontal
        Returns:
        'b'...'r'
        Throws:
        Panel.PanelOutOfBoundsException
        Panel.PanelNotPlacedException
        Board.FieldsNotEmptyException
        TooManyPanelsException

      • getPanel

        public Panel getPanel(Pos pos)
        Returns the Panel at a particular position.
        Parameters:
        pos - a position
        Returns:

        Returns:
        a Map of Panels

      • getFields

        public Panel[] getFields()
        Returns a reference to the array of 100 fields which each point to a Panel or to null if no panel is at the corresponding position.
        Returns:
        array of panels

      • getBoardCode

        public java.lang.String getBoardCode()
        Returns a 200-character representation of the current Board with owners set to 0.
        Returns:
        board code

      • getSize

        public static int getSize(char code)
        Returns the size of a panel with the code code.
        Parameters:
        code - 'b'...'r'
        Returns:
        size 2, 3, 4, or 6

      • getAvailableCode

        private char getAvailableCode(int size)
                       throws TooManyPanelsException
        Returns the lowest available code for a panel of size size.

        Throws a TooManyPanelsException if no code is available.

        Parameters:
        size - 2, 3, 4, or 6
        Returns:
        'b'...'r'
        Throws:
        TooManyPanelsException
